instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936 green light with liquid damage
threads.message:
Board has liquid damage with obvious corrosion around C7272/C7273 and also around F7040 area. Green light. No fan spin.

U7200 generates PP5V_S5 and has 5V when measured at pin 1 of C7273.

However, when measure the same PP5V_S5 at C7801, it is only 3.05V. But when I tried to measure the continuity between pin 1 of C7273 and pin 1 C7801, they dont seem to be connected. When looked carefully the test point/circular pad that is next to pin 1 of C7273 is gone.

threads.title: 820-2936 green light with liquid damage
threads.message:
I have put in a jumper between and now the fan spin but stay high speed, I have got mouse led too.

But C7272 actually came off with corroded solder pad .... is it OK to leave that removed?

threads.title: 820-2936 green light with liquid damage
threads.message:
The board can work w/o C7272.
Shouldn't be so difficult to replace it; you can find another point to use in the same rail.

Did you test external video and USB activity?
Check CPU VCORE after 10-15 seconds; it should drop to 0.7V aprox.

threads.title: 820-2936 green light with liquid damage
threads.message:
Yes PPVCORE_S0_CPU is 0.7v. I didnt have the heatsink on so maybe that's why it was on high speed fan.

USB mouse led only works on 1 port.

I checked L4610 was bad. Pin 3 and Pin 4 are open. However, I have replaced L4610 still no good. PP5V_S3_RTUSB_B_F = 5v. 


Bad D4610 or U2600? The diode mode between the 2 data pin is 117 vs the other working port 1150

threads.title: 820-2936 green light with liquid damage
threads.message:
Compare diode mode to ground readings between both ports.
Remember, red probe connected to ground; black probe at data pin.

threads.title: 820-2936 green light with liquid damage
threads.message:
Verified that it booted up fine with linux on usb via the good USB port [with a usb hub and mouse/keyboard attached] and also connected LCD panel and display is OK.

Diode mode reading to ground:
L4600 (good port): Pin1&2: 440 Pin3&4: 435
L4610 (bad port):   Pin1&2: 459 Pin3&4: 458

threads.title: 820-2936 green light with liquid damage
threads.message: Inspect U2600 area; check all solders, surrounding components and traces.

threads.title: 820-2936 green light with liquid damage
threads.message:
I think it turns out that D4610 is bad as I was getting intermittent result... removing D4610 then the USB port is working.... 

Let me replace it and see what happen
